INAYA Putri Bali
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1391 reviews

Stayed at inaya for 3 days 2 nights. At first I was blown away by the location. It's a very big property with lots of space and a beach.

We arrived at 11 but since our room was not ready we had to leave our luggage at the concierge. We left and came back at 9pm in which our room was ready and luggage had already been delivered.. great! We had a room on the first floor that opened up to a small pool. Beautiful but COLD! I wanted to swim in it so bad but too cold for me. My husband swam in it fighting the cold water. So it was time to shower and oh boy.. the bathroom shower was disgusting! There was mold between the tiles and tiny flies flying around. The moment I turned on the shower water the shower room smelled like sewer. I don't know where the smell was coming from but I took a sample of the water in a clean clear cup to make sure it wasn't dirty before I took a shower. It was fine. The free WiFi was weak. The TV did not work at times. The phone did not work. It got frustrating.

Show more
Lornalyn , United States
The Canopi Resort
8.4 Excellent
Based on 248 reviews

I would like to comment on the top notch service from all the staff here! They are extremely friendly and would help us in all the ways they can.

This resort is very near to a town call Pujasera where we can took a 7 mins scooter ride out. There is a hawker center there selling authentic Indonesian food at local price and 2 convenient stores for us to grab some beer and tit-bits for the night. For those experience rider, you can rent their 125cc to go explore more places. The activities here are enough to keep you occupied for 2 days stay. If you just like to sit down 1 corner and relax, just sit beside the lagoon and enjoy the breeze...At first I find that the resort is expensive but after staying here for 2 days.The transfer from the ferry terminal and back, collection of our ferry tickets on behalf of us, the superb customer service... I feel that every cents is worth it! Will return with more friends.

Show more
William , Singapore
Hotel Mulia Senayan, Jakarta
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1225 reviews

dissapointed on checkin.Put us on twin bed room as a couple. Its the first time I am not satisfied among the others great expriences by Agoda.

Need more firm on term and condition. Finally we had the proper room after some irrelevant reason given to us. The rest of the staff was quite good. Lobby and public area looked great but the room and inroom facility were old (not the classic one). Will think twice to come again due some of other better hotel not so far away from there. However, food and dine was quite fantastic. That the only good point.

Show more
Erich , Indonesia
Fairmont Jakarta Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 410 reviews

We love our stay in Fairmont Jakarta, the room is cozy and clean, view is fantastic, no noise even though the hotel is located in one of the busiest shopping street.

We love the nice bathroom. The only flaw was the breakfast. It wasn't that delicious, just so-so. Next time we book for fairmont, we will skip the breakfast option and might book for a room w/o breakfast.

Show more
Steffy , Indonesia
Legian Beach Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1229 reviews

My daughter,12 and I came here as we wanted to go to a nearby surf school. We turned up at 4 PM, having booked a 'superior' room.

Check-in process took a long time, and they informed me that as availability was 'low', our room was nowhere near the sea/pool, (we'd requested). Took us to see the room, which was far from facilities and beach. The bed was hard, there were no windows, a smell of air freshener, it was dark, and very close to the road/traffic noise. Went back to reception to complain about this so-called 'superior' room, and were told there was nothing else available . I had said I'd pay more for a better room even if they wouldn't upgrade me themselves. No, they said, nothing available at all. We went to the pool to think it over. It was dirty and had broken tiles. 2 hrs later, hotel offered us an upgrade, a room on 4th floor with window. Nicer, but still very far away from pool etc. & beds rock hard. Rude staff with bad attitude had really put us off. We checked out.

Show more
RUTH , United Kingdom
The Trans Luxury Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 2157 reviews

Price is on the high side but the room and swimming pool for kids are indeed unique. Convenient as it is next to a shopping mall.

Went there during year end week and place was crowded but still well-managed. Only complaint is that the driver recommended to me by one of the concierge, his car had no air-con. As the traffic was very bad, my wife, baby and I were sweating in the car for two hours each during our journey to and from floating market. But driver still insisted i paid full rph 500k for his service. Extremely disappointed as it was our wedding anniversary and wife birthday.

Show more
Muhd , Singapore
Hotel Tentrem Yogyakarta
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1329 reviews

this is my first time staying at this hotel and i enjoyed it... The single bed is bigger and more comfort than other hotels.

..the room is spacious too even with an extra bed in it.. i definitely will be back here again and bring my family.. because the kids playground look fun and for breakfast they even provide kids menu in a special section in the restaurant called "breakfast for kids" ( with cartoon character plate for children to use)

Show more
Putri , Indonesia
Grandkemang Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 1143 reviews

I stayed in this hotel with two of my friends. The location is not in the city center but there are a few nice restaurants and bars near the hotel so, the location was not a problem.

It was easy to access the city center and malls by taxi but the only problem was traffic jam. The hotel was clean, and the staff were friendly and polite. My friends and I enjoyed the pool a lot so, we went swimming twice a day. The breakfast was amazing, a lot of choices of food. Overall, this hotel is really a good value!!!

Show more
MISUN , South Korea
Pullman Jakarta Indonesia
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3723 reviews

The services was great, from frontdesk, restaurants, the room, everything. Staffs were very friendly and attentive.

Good job! The only think that a bit confusing is when you want to go to the gym from second floor new wing lift(near the business centre). Perhaps should put signage for easy to locate the gym from there. Other than that everything is great.. the food is the hotel restaurant is really tasty.. will definately come here again when flying into jakarta.. 😊

Show more
Azni , Malaysia
Pullman Jakarta Central Park Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3673 reviews

Only negative was the smell of cigarette smoke. Originally allocated a smoking room but then upgraded to a non smoking room following my complaint.

Very helpful staff. Room was fine and was evidently in non smoking floor however still smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. Aside from that service and restaurants were terrific. Has a great mall next door.

Show more
Sandra , Australia
Shangri-la Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 549 reviews

This stay was meant to be a relaxation getaway, however we experienced any hiccups during our first trip here.

Cleanliness has to be looking to. There were wrappers in under the TV shelves and dust and hair on working desk, at the new room after we experienced some fault in the toilet drainage system. No steam and Jacuzzi currently due to renovation works, was not informed pre-arrival nor at check in. Had to proceed to the residence, a little inconvenience, therefore we only went once throughout our stay there. None the less, it was enjoyable and looking forward to come back again :)

Show more
BRENDA , Singapore
Century Park Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 3218 reviews

This hotel although doesn't look very appealing on the outside, but inside it's ok. All rooms are smoke-free; smoking only allowed in designated areas.

Rooms & bathrooms are very spacious with full amenities. The only thing is along the corridor of room floors, there is a musky smell which I hope the hotel would do something to eliminate the odor. There's good breakfast spread served at the Dapour Coffee House, consists of local, asian, western, japanese cuisines. This hotel is also centrally located. It's not smack in the heart of city (which is usually heavy in traffic) but just a little off from city center, perhaps less than 5kms. Around the hotel area (Senayan) there are many big shopping malls & Senayan Plaza and FX Sudirman is within walking distance (less than 5mins!). Should we visit again we'll consider staying at (Atlet) Century Park Hotel again.

Show more
Yvonne , Malaysia
Gran Mahakam Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1598 reviews

I like Gran Mahakam hotel but it does not live up to the 5 stars' standard. For example, upon checking in, there was only one front desk employee and she was busy talking over the phone.

Where are the other employees? I had booked a suite room but the TV remote was nowhere to be found. What makes a 5 star hotel a 5 star is the attention to the little details...

Show more
Irene , Indonesia
Hotel Indonesia Kempinski Jakarta
9 Excellent
Based on 1483 reviews

Great Hotel and we got a room overlooking the traffic circle, this should be great right? The police station, right at the circle was blasting music Saturday evening until 10:00 pm.

. I phoned to see where the music was coming from. No big deal they turn it off at 10:00. The problem is they start testing the speakers at 5:30 AM and blasting the music at 6:00 AM the next morning = no sleeping in if you have stayed up late or just want to sleep in. It is car free day but the music from the police station will wake you up early, no thanks. I was not aware of this. Never again. The hotel itself was very nice, staff helpful and the breakfast buffet was great.

Show more
Ross , Indonesia
Inna Grand Bali Beach Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 1310 reviews

I first stayed in January 2016 with my children and, despite having room issues back then (we had to move three times in five days) I decided to visit again with my partner in August.

Not a lot has changed: the hotel is still in need of a coat of paint but you can't fault the staff and the location. It's just that bit far north of the busiest beach area that you get very little through traffic. The beach is private, peaceful and clean as are the pool areas. Breakfast options are plentiful and the food is good quality and reasonably priced (although with so many fabulous local restaurants in Sanur, why anyone eats at their resort I do not know). This is very good value for money - but don't stay if you think you're getting sparkly new five-star. It's dated but clean but the location and price make up for anything.

Show more
Alison , Australia
The BCC Hotel & Residence
7.7 Very good
Based on 4690 reviews

My family arrived the hotel at about 12pm , the staff highlighted we are able check in at 2pm as our room is not ready, where we r back at 2pm , the front staff side our room is not ready and the offer us a late check out for tomorrow.

Then the nightmare came when we check in , 1) found one side door missing at the carbine 2) refrigerator are missing 3) bed are dirty 4) water basin was full of water Upon I feedback to the front staff, they told me the room is are what so call kind of design -missing door and no refrigerator , I told them why did not mentioned when we check in , Tham the duty manger sept in and told us this all this are highlighted in the hotel website , upon ask for proof from their website , they are unable to find any. What a stupid room design with missing door and refrigerator and keep guest in dark with all the ???? when checking into the room -feel sad

Show more
Soh , Singapore
Le Grandeur Mangga Dua Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 3796 reviews

No hand towels were given because "we have no more, it is still washing" Is not an acceptable explanation at a five star hotel.

When I asked to provide 3 hand towels when it is ready, only two was given. The other bath towels were old, possibly from Dusit because it had tears and it was grey. My baby used it and now have rashes on his face. Maybe it was from the bedding, I am not sure. But the bedding also had holes in them. Very hard to find housekeeping or room service (phone is always busy) Only gave us one set of amenities when the room was booked for three adults. Asked to provide another one before I get back, and it was not given. Overall, besides the breakfast and one bellboy, everything was below standard.

Show more
Mei , Taiwan
Da Vienna Boutique Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 2273 reviews

Rooms: Our 3 rooms were not ready when we arrived at 2pm. Had to wait for 35mins while the other guests arrived and were given their rooms.

One of the room smelled of cigarette smoke despite being a non-smoking room. However, at least the rooms were big and clean. Breakfast: The porridge was cold and the soto ayam was salty. There are a varieties of bread and the omelette/ eggs was good. There are rice with curry chicken. Overall, not much of a spread of breakfast. Hotel: It is within walking distance to Nagoya Hill Shopping Centre about 10mins. No cafe or shops outside the hotel area so you must walk to the shopping centre. Overall verdict: I may return to stay at this hotel minus the waiting time.

Show more
Elizabeth , Singapore
The Park Lane Jakarta
8 Very good
Based on 1355 reviews

This was my first stay at this hotel. The deluxe room was comfortable and all amenities provided were in good working order.

However, I was surprised to note that the information folder in the room did not provide any information on the available dining facilities at the hotel. The on-going renovation works should be completed quickly to provide a better ambience for the guests.

Show more
Jagjit , Malaysia
Hotel Borobudur Jakarta
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2131 reviews

Good hotel for facilities and location, bring good memories when i was childhood often to stay at this hotel, service in singosari rest is good and dinner at bogor cafe also good, but at bfast time not to good , i saw not too much guest for bfast at around 9.

00am but when i ask something to bring like salt and pepper they didnt bring to us and table set up there,s no napkin , but the chef at egg was awesome and full service they bring the egg that we reserved to our table, everything ok except the service staff

Show more
Jimmy , Indonesia
Kuta Paradiso Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1997 reviews

The Kuta Paradiso Hotel was very nice with excellent facilities and a fantastic breakfast buffet (best we had in Indonesia)! I was a bit disappointed with the location of our room within the hotel (1st floor located above a bank of HVAC units that were loud and hot when outside on the balcony), but the room itself was fine.

Location of the hotel is great, very close to the beach, a large market and central to tons of restaurants and shops. Too bad Kuta itself has become such a non-descript tourism ghetto. Nothing to do with the Kuta Paradiso Hotel, but I would not stay in Kuta again, I would look for a hotel near one of the other local beaches (e.g., Echo Beach) that are less crowded and still retain some Balinese character. There's nothing "Bali" about Kuta, unfortunately...

Show more
Paul , Canada
Manhattan Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 3738 reviews

The hotel is superb, specially considering the money we paid for it. Location is great with various malls, chain restaurants and even street stalls all nearby.

Even going for a morning stroll is enjoying in this posh part of Jakarta. Night view from our 21st floor room was awesome. Location, nice swimming pool, friendly and helpful staff, spacious lobby & bar are all positives. View from the 36th floor & the pool was great as well The mild and tasteful Christmas decoration was a bonus. Only hope they would improve the breakfast service a bit. Apart from that, would definitely stay again.

Show more
MD , Bangladesh
Sahid Eminence Hotel Convention & Resort
7.7 Very good
Based on 315 reviews

I dont know what to say again, verry disappointed with this hotel, the room is not clean dust almost everywhere, the floor, wall panel, bathroom and also we found cockroach in the room, the water soo yellow, yaak.

Dust and dirty also found in lift, and almost everyside of hotel. Breakfast its also poor service, they open 6.00-10.30 but at 7.30 almost every stall empty, im waiting for 35-40mnt to fill up again, thatttsss soooo loong ! We stay 2 nights and always happen like this, not recomended at all, "hotel dengan lokasi baik, pemandangan indah, design kamar menarik, SANGAT DISAYANGKAN TIDAK DIDUKUNG OLEH STAF DAN SYSTEM YANG BAIK", dengan harga seperti itu ga worthied banget !

Show more
rocky , Indonesia
HARRIS Vertu Hotel Harmoni
8.8 Excellent
Based on 334 reviews

Standout project by Tauzia, a beautiful landmark in Harmoni area. the hotel is dedicated for those who seeking for an 'affordable' luxury hotel.

the hotel facilities, design, ambience, and especially the street art wallpaper will leave you in awe. The staffs were good, always greet us with smile. Even the hotel's General Manager can be easily found in the lobby, trying to communicate or helping guests find their needs. Top notch service!

Show more
Febriyadi , Indonesia
Kristal Hotel Jakarta
7.9 Very good
Based on 330 reviews

Probably the last time we stayed in this hotel. It gets more and more difficult to get there and away due to the traffic.

Besides, there are no great dining options in the neighbourhood, since the food of Kristal is terrible. Overcooked and underspiced. The room size is great, but the kingsize bed is not even queenish.

Show more
Pieter , Netherlands
The Anvaya Beach Resort - Bali
8.8 Excellent
Based on 136 reviews

Room in premier wing is large n clean, design interior is very nice. This hotel having 3 pools and private beach.

Breakfast menu is quite complete n okay. Location in kuta near discovery mall, but having 1 way road is affecting the location convenience. Overall is nica hotel but a bit expensive

Show more
Andi , Indonesia
HARRIS Hotel & Conventions Kelapa Gading
8.1 Excellent
Based on 2521 reviews

Location, location and location is the main reason for me and family to stay here. Harris is connected to Mall Kelapa Gading and it is very convenience for me and my kid.

I hv stayed here twice and had good experiences. Room is spacious, new, and comfy. However, in my stay this time, i got a slightly bad experience with the staff. No one help us with the bagagge once we arrived. Small things though. Overall we enjoyed Harris!

Show more
Levi , Indonesia
The Bandha Hotel & Suites
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 254 reviews

Booked 2 rooms with connecting doors. Large cozy rooms with balcony facing the pool. Love its interior and find a helpful bench on the shower box for older/younger child to enjoy the waterflow.

Water smell like sea and taste a bit salty - I hope management could fix it, otherwise would be a perfect hotel. Breakfast in mozarella restaurant is very good facing the legian beach - service is excellent, friendly and nice staffs around breakfast area. Pool area is lovely - serve drinks in lagoon and lend books to read while sunbathing. Gym equipment is very good. Will come back! Note: Entrance to this hotel from jalan legian turn left to jalanpadma then turn right to jalan padma utara - googlemap shows wrong direction since the road is one way. It is next to Bali niksoma when ask direction to locals coz they don't know this brand new hotel.

Show more
Vera , Indonesia
Hotel Vila Lumbung
7.9 Very good
Based on 658 reviews

The hotel has a great Bali feel, with friendly staff and the room i was in was satistfactory. The pool area is great.

The hotel location was ok, just a 15 min walk to Seminyak Square or a 2 min taxi ride. The only problems that i can say is that the hotel is not that suited to young children, there is no kids pool or shallow area but you could get by. Another thing was that the shower head in the room was in a bad position as it was in the middle of the bath and water sprayed straight onto the floor. Even with the few small concerns this was still a good hotel and I would stay there again.

Show more
Jason , Australia
ARTOTEL Thamrin - Jakarta
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1946 reviews

I always look up on Artotel since it is like an upgraded budget hotel. The facilities are more improved than the normally budget hotel, the price doesn't have big different with the rest of budget hotel.

My stay is nice. The bed is big enough for 2, the bathroom is not small either. But the staff almost lost my dress, which I intend to put in their laundry. The day after when I ask for that dress, they said that they didn't receive an order to laundry. So they just left it in 'lost & found' section. You should be more careful on that. Moreover, I need to go to receptionist every day because my room key card is not working. Besides from that, it is really a pleasant stay. Thank you

Show more
Cindy , Indonesia
RIMBA Jimbaran BALI by AYANA
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 1431 reviews

Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay of three nights in the new wing. The rooms we were staying are quite roomy and comfortable.

My kids loved the bathtub. The view at the lobby was breathtaking. As Rimba guests, we were not only allowed to use its facilities, but also Ayana's facilities. My children loved the pools both at Ayana and Rimba. There is a shuttle service between the 2 hotels. The staff were quite attentive, they were given my husband a surprise birthday cake which was much appreciated as it is no where to buy a birthday cake at the resort. The hotel was also giving away nice souvenirs for the Christmas day. The food at Ah Yat restaurant were also yummy.

Show more
Henri , Australia
Alila Seminyak
8.9 Excellent
Based on 376 reviews

My partner & i booked the Alila Ocean Suite at Alila Seminyak for 3d2n, Sun-Tue. From the moment we arrived to our departure, it was such a wonderful experience.

All the staff are obviously very uniformly well trained, from the security to front desk to wait staff. Everyone we met were very polite, proactive & helpful. Service was excellent & thoughtful. It is part of the spa area where you can get 1 best option for photo capturing. Included breakfast was served in ready set and not a buffet type were you can have pretty much options. Ovrall, we were so delighted and satisfied we chose La Joya Biu Biu that means we highly recommend this place especially for honeymooners and couples like us.

haydee , Philippines
Sunset Coin Lembongan Cottage & Spa
8.5 Excellent
Based on 136 reviews

We planned to spend 2 nights in Lembongan at Sunset Coin but finally decided to stay for 6 nights, because the island is very nice and offers many things to do (scuba and free diving, snork, surf, tours with motorbike, farniente …) , and because we enjoyed staying at this hotel.

Sunset Coin is a nice and quiet boutique hotel with 3 Balinese huts and 2 nice cottages, well arranged, with a nice pool and a beautiful garden. Staff is very attentive, friendly, efficient and welcoming. The food at the restaurant is very good and it is Indonesian style. Massages at the hotel spa are also very good (we tried oil massage). The hotel is located behind Sandy beach club, but is only 50m from Sunset beach. We could rent a motorbike and explore the island as well Ceningan, and you can reach the main beach Jungut Batu in 10-15 min with motorbike. When we were there, staff (Gede, Ketut and Gede) were expecting having one week later a card machine to allow customers to pay by credit cards. If you are looking for relaxing and zen atmosphere, Lembongan is a very good choice in Bali as well as Sunset Coin.

The hotel is around a 20 minute walk to the main centre of Ubud but there are many restaurants within 5 minutes distance. Very memorable holiday made even better by the great team they have working here. 5*.

Its a super single bed. The standard room is the one with the queen bed but price wise its a little higher. I really liked the entire hotel decor and experience, so the higher price was worth it. My check-in was odd. Assigned to a room without my room key (staff used master key) because apparently the room keys are not distributed at night. And when I entered, I found someone elses belongings in the room. It was an honest mistake by the hotel for forgetting that a guest checked out but left his luggage in the room. But I guess, such mistakes are terrible if someone actually loses their things. Wonderful staff though. 8.7 Excellent

The actual room is probably much like any other homestay- comfy bed, powerful cold shower, ensuite, plug sockets, bench outside and drying rack.

What makes this place stand out though is the access to the smart beach front sister hotel with lovely pool and a huge buffet breakfast every morning. We found with such a big breakfast we didn't need lunch, so we saved plenty of money. At one point we stayed in a homestay further inland for a night and it turned out the mosque is there- needless to say after 4:50am we didn't sleep any more with the call to prayer. So don't be tempted by cheaper inland prices, this place is as far back as you want to be. I highly recommend staying here, it really is the best deal we've had in months!

Mr. Ketut and family warmly welcomed us to their tranquil home stay. Our family rented 3 rooms with bath, all very clean & comfortable with air conditioning and small outdoor patios with sitting area which we all used.

Great pool. Mr Ketut arranged massages for 5 of us after we arrived, these were done in the lower level outside were you listened to the tranquil creek below. Our friends booked 3 of the larger rooms located down the cliff and other than the stairs, had a great time. When you arrive you fill out a form for their home cooked breakfast you will enjoy the next day, note: they do charge a fee for a second cup of coffee. The huts are in a great little spot. There is a small beach less than 50m away and as this forms part of a small cove it is private.

The main Bea h, harbour and fancy cliff side resorts are less than10 mins walk away by cliff path and so you feelsecluded yet are near to a range of restaurants. Food at hotel is well priced and tasty too. The resort is small. There are 6 bungalows and all are well down with beautiful gardens and flowers on hillside. Bathroom is slightly open but we suffered less with mozzies here than elsewhere on island. Staff are nice and helpful without being intrusive. Only egative here are visiting surfers. The hotel allows diners to use pool as well as guests. This is fine. However we had on two occasions large groups of surfers who bought one drink between 5 people and stayed all day at pool...including washing surf baords in it! We felt bad for staff who clearly thought this was an abuse but didn't want to throw people out as this system is across island. So if you do visit...please buy a meal if you plan to use pool!

Cocoa Ubud Private Villa
8.6 Excellent
Based on 187 reviews

We arrived at Cocoa Ubud late at night and were greeted by the most friendly staff and the most beautiful villa.

The photos do not do it justice and for the price it far exceeded my expectations. Cocoa Ubud is a family run business which I feel makes it extra special and their service so much better. There are so many details that made my stay here one of the best I've experienced, not only in Ubud, but in any of the places I have ever stayed. A complimentary return journey into Ubud is offered daily and a mobile phone is given so that you can just call them when you're ready to be collected. Ubud is a 5 minute drive away so there's no waiting around and it's a very convenient service. If you've used your complimentary trip there's a small fee to use their driver which is worth it to not have the hassle of trying to find your way back. Breakfast is lovingly cooked by Mum and will be served by one of the many brothers, sisters or cousins in the family. The room was cleaned daily at our convenience and our beds turned down at night. And having your own pool to cool down in after long, hot days in Ubud was just fabulous! I really enjoyed my stay at Cocoa Ubud and will certainly stay there again when I'm next in Bali.

At first I was blown away by the location. It's a very big property with lots of space and a beach. We arrived at 11 but since our room was not ready we had to leave our luggage at the concierge. We left and came back at 9pm in which our room was ready and luggage had already been delivered.. great! We had a room on the first floor that opened up to a small pool. Beautiful but COLD! I wanted to swim in it so bad but too cold for me. My husband swam in it fighting the cold water. So it was time to shower and oh boy.. the bathroom shower was disgusting! There was mold between the tiles and tiny flies flying around. The moment I turned on the shower water the shower room smelled like sewer. I don't know where the smell was coming from but I took a sample of the water in a clean clear cup to make sure it wasn't dirty before I took a shower. It was fine. The free WiFi was weak. The TV did not work at times. The phone did not work. It got frustrating. Show more Lornalyn , United States The Canopi Resort 8.4 Excellent Based on 248 reviews I would like to comment on the top notch service from all the staff here! They are extremely friendly and would help us in all the ways they can. This resort is very near to a town call Pujasera where we can took a 7 mins scooter ride out. There is a hawker center there selling authentic Indonesian food at local price and 2 convenient stores for us to grab some beer and tit-bits for the night. For those experience rider, you can rent their 125cc to go explore more places. The activities here are enough to keep you occupied for 2 days stay. If you just like to sit down 1 corner and relax, just sit beside the lagoon and enjoy the breeze...At first I find that the resort is expensive but after staying here for 2 days.The transfer from the ferry terminal and back, collection of our ferry tickets on behalf of us, the superb customer service... I feel that every cents is worth it! Will return with more friends. Show more Steffy , Indonesia Legian Beach Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 1229 reviews My daughter,12 and I came here as we wanted to go to a nearby surf school. We turned up at 4 PM, having booked a 'superior' room. Check-in process took a long time, and they informed me that as availability was 'low', our room was nowhere near the sea/pool, (we'd requested). Took us to see the room, which was far from facilities and beach. The bed was hard, there were no windows, a smell of air freshener, it was dark, and very close to the road/traffic noise. Went back to reception to complain about this so-called 'superior' room, and were told there was nothing else available . I had said I'd pay more for a better room even if they wouldn't upgrade me themselves. No, they said, nothing available at all. We went to the pool to think it over. It was dirty and had broken tiles. 2 hrs later, hotel offered us an upgrade, a room on 4th floor with window. Nicer, but still very far away from pool etc. & beds rock hard. Rude staff with bad attitude had really put us off. We checked out. It's not smack in the heart of city (which is usually heavy in traffic) but just a little off from city center, perhaps less than 5kms. Around the hotel area (Senayan) there are many big shopping malls & Senayan Plaza and FX Sudirman is within walking distance (less than 5mins!). Show more Irene , Indonesia Hotel Indonesia Kempinski Jakarta 9 Excellent Based on 1483 reviews Great Hotel and we got a room overlooking the traffic circle, this should be great right? The police station, right at the circle was blasting music Saturday evening until 10:00 pm. . I phoned to see where the music was coming from. No big deal they turn it off at 10:00. The problem is they start testing the speakers at 5:30 AM and blasting the music at 6:00 AM the next morning = no sleeping in if you have stayed up late or just want to sleep in. It is car free day but the music from the police station will wake you up early, no thanks. I was not aware of this. Never again. The hotel itself was very nice, staff helpful and the breakfast buffet was great. Show more Ross , Indonesia Inna Grand Bali Beach Hotel 7.2 Very good Based on 1310 reviews I first stayed in January 2016 with my children and, despite having room issues back then (we had to move three times in five days) I decided to visit again with my partner in August. Not a lot has changed: the hotel is still in need of a coat of paint but you can't fault the staff and the location. It's just that bit far north of the busiest beach area that you get very little through traffic. The beach is private, peaceful and clean as are the pool areas. Breakfast options are plentiful and the food is good quality and reasonably priced (although with so many fabulous local restaurants in Sanur, why anyone eats at their resort I do not know). This is very good value for money - but don't stay if you think you're getting sparkly new five-star. It's dated but clean but the location and price make up for anything. But hey this is Semiyak not one of the remote islands. Great few days mini break and will stay again. A young hotel that wants to please, in a competitive evolving Seminyak. We were shown an extremely run down room at the back of the hotel on the 1st floor. The villa was large and relatively clean, with the exception of the bathroom area. The grounds, including the pool, community room and pool were well kept. A decent value for the price. However the location is rather secluded, tucked away on the edge of a ravine off of a narrow dirt road. Several taxi drivers didn't know where the location was or how to get there, particularly in dark. Best for a couple or individual comfortable with mH Pros Friendly and helpful staff Secluded Spacious Good value Peaceful Beautiful grounds including infinity pool Filling and tasty breakfast Cons Location challenging for several taxi drivers to find Bathroom was not clean Somewhat noisy at night (motor bikes- though not sure where the noise was coming from since tucked away on a rural dirt road Wifi only available in the main room and when staff turned on* No phones/ way to reach staff from villas (other than walking to front area - which was far from the villa I stayed in)* * both raised as safety concerns from guest who did not have local/international mobile service, so may not be a concern for other travelers Show more Megan , United States MK House SCBD 7.6 Very good Based on 19 reviews Lotus Bungalows 8.6 Excellent Based on 60 reviews Lotus is a gem among the many nice hotels in the Candidasa area. The rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable, with nice open-air bathrooms. Because there are not many bungalows, the hotel area is quiet, and we enjoyed swimming in the pool, lounging in the areas around the pool, or just sitting in front of our room looking out across the grass to the pool and ocean beyond. Breakfast was fairly standard but the pizzas we had for dinner was fantastic. The staff are all friendly and a special bonus for us was that our 4-year-old daughter found a couple of playmates in the daughters of one of the staff members. This hotel had mostly Australian people (bogans included) but i did not mind my stay for 2 days. Note to management - please edit language of all nasty notes throughout the hotel like in bathroom, room, toilets etc. I know you may have had bad experiences with people not using common sense, but your language made me feel as if i was in a school rather than a holiday. Staff was polite though. Overall if you dont mind Kuta you can consider this busy hotel Show more Rohit , Australia Petitenget 501 Resort 8.6 Excellent Based on 128 reviews Basically there's nothing to complain about this place. The only problem we encountered during our stay was the shortage of water during the few hours of our arrival but it was resolved very quickly so it was not an issue. Show more Julie , Malaysia AP Suite & Apartment 7.4 Very good Based on 261 reviews Reached about 1900hrs to check in and was told they did not have our booking. Waited for a good hour while they checked and in the end was told to come back at 2100hrs for their manager. Came back, and still no manager. Told us that they had a room. But we will have to pay upfront as walk in rate and agoda will refund our money. It's a two room apartment and we had to top up since we only paid for a one room apartment. I refused to pay and in the end they allowed us to stay for one night in the two room apartment first while they sorted things out. I emailed agoda and thank god they replied really quickly. Was told that they will speak to the hotel and hotel will have to honour our booking. So thank you agoda! Next day, we had to change to a one room apartment. Room is big but nothing else was fantastic about the room. Next day, we went out and when we came back, our room was flooded cos the pipe in the toilet burst. Called them and insisted that they change our room. We had to move so many times! It really is not worth my money. Location is actually quite far from the beach unless you rent a motor to get around. So unless absolutely necessary, this place is not recommended. The room has a kitchenette so sterlising bottles for my kids was easy. The balcony was perfect to sit out after the children slept and have a quiet drink with wife. While still keeping an eye on the children in the room. Food at the restaurant is huge portions so order lesser. We had to waste a lot of food the first day. The photos do not do it justice and for the price it far exceeded my expectations. Cocoa Ubud is a family run business which I feel makes it extra special and their service so much better. There are so many details that made my stay here one of the best I've experienced, not only in Ubud, but in any of the places I have ever stayed. A complimentary return journey into Ubud is offered daily and a mobile phone is given so that you can just call them when you're ready to be collected. Ubud is a 5 minute drive away so there's no waiting around and it's a very convenient service. If you've used your complimentary trip there's a small fee to use their driver which is worth it to not have the hassle of trying to find your way back. Breakfast is lovingly cooked by Mum and will be served by one of the many brothers, sisters or cousins in the family. The room was cleaned daily at our convenience and our beds turned down at night. And having your own pool to cool down in after long, hot days in Ubud was just fabulous! I really enjoyed my stay at Cocoa Ubud and will certainly stay there again when I'm next in Bali.
